page.title: 12Fordell House
page.content: Fordell House was built in 1721 by { {Sir John Henderson},the third baronet. It was a grand 43-roomed house but was demolished in{1963.} Only the foundations remain today. { { Fordell Castle Fordell Castle was built in the early {16th century}and is a splendid example of a Scottish towerhouse. It was rebuilt after a fire destroyed it in 1568. The castle was owned by James Henderson and stayed with them for 400 hundred years. Two of the lairds died in battle wth the English and another 17th century laird was a mercenary captain in the Mediterranean sea. The family later moved into the newly built Fordell House.When the estate was broken up it was eventually purchased by Mr Nicholas Fairbairn (Solicitor_General for Scotland).
